intro: Erodium cicutarium proles bipinnatum, commonly known as the two-pinnate field penny-cress, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its small, bright yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves, which are often divided into three leaflets. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Its seeds are small and contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. The species is native to Europe but has been introduced to various parts of the world, including North America.
